articles.title: WATCH: NASA astronaut’s view of northern lights from space
articles.description: The brilliant aurora was followed by a major geomagnetic storm triggered by a solar flare emitted from the Sun last Friday.
articles.content:
The video was captured by shared by NASA astronaut, Anne McClain, who is onboard the SpaceX Dragon spacecraft, docked with the International Space Station. (Screengrab)
One of the most mesmerising sights in the night sky, the aurora borealis, or more... [649 chars]

articles.title: Second child dies three weeks after minibus accident on M4 slip road
articles.description: Othniel Adoma, 11, from Bracknell, died on Thursday, while five other children who were injured have been discharged from hospital
articles.content:
An 11-year-old boy has become the second child to die after a minibus overturned on a motorway slip road in Berkshire last month, police have said.
Othniel Adoma, from Bracknell, died on Thursday, more than three weeks after the single-vehicle crash.... [1093 chars]

articles.title: ‘An awful incident to witness’: 10 cattle killed in lightning strike in Co Cavan
articles.description: Heifers had taken shelter from rain under tree when lightning struck the earth, instantly killing them
articles.content:
Ten cattle have been killed following a lightning strike in Butlersbridge in Co Cavan.
Cavan Fianna Fáil TD Brendan Smith, who lives in the area said that what had taken place on Friday evening was a “terrible shock” to the farmer.
“The loss of ten a... [1741 chars]

articles.title: Birmingham’s free-running bull rehomed in Norwich animal sanctuary
articles.description: The animal, thought to have escaped from an abattoir, was corralled by council staff before being offered his new home
articles.content:
A bull that ran loose through the streets of Birmingham – after apparently escaping from an abattoir – has been given a new home by an animal sanctuary in Norfolk.
The stray bovine, thought to be about two years old, was safely contained by Birmingha... [2793 chars]

articles.title: Bidders demand Thames Water granted immunity over environmental crimes
articles.description: Exclusive: ‘Ransom note’ requests would leave Environment Agency unable to prosecute company or management
articles.content:
Lenders vying to take over Thames Water have demanded that the struggling company and its management be granted immunity from prosecution for serious environmental crimes as a condition of acquiring it, the Guardian can reveal.

articles.title: Meghalaya murder mystery: MP CM Mohan Yadav urges Amit Shah to order CBI probe Indore woman’s disappearance
articles.description: Though Raja's body was found with wounds inflicted by a machete, the whereabouts of Soman is still uncertain. Despite a Special Investigation Team being formed to look into the incident, no arrests have been made so far.
articles.content:
Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav on Saturday requested Union Home Minister Amit Shah to order a CBI probe into the disappearance of an Indore woman in Meghalaya, reported PTI.

articles.title: Donald Trump says 'no' to mending ties with Elon Musk, issues 'very serious' warning
articles.description: Donald Trump told NBC News that Elon Musk was ‘disrespectful’ toward the president's office.
articles.content: US President Donald Trump on Saturday warned Elon Musk of “serious consequences” if the tech billionaire goes on to finance Democratic candidates to run against Republicans who vote in favour of his tax cuts and spending bill. President Donald Trump,... [2394 chars]
